item.title: Wisconsin Really is Better Than Minnesota
item.dc:creator: Lily Hemmersbach
item.description:
The border battle is basically a personality trait at this point for Wisconsin and Minnesota. If there is one thing mid-westerners love more than cheese curds and football is this rivalry. Wisconsin has cheese curds, tailgating, and beer. What does Minnesota even have?

Code 
library(tidyverse)
library(hoopR)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggalt)
library(ggtext)
library(gt)
library(rvest)
library(hoopR)

mlb <- read_csv("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vTpoNkooywS_R5VoSyzKXVYiaH8E0L_B6PpdXGL4PMDwlgFyE4HzwXqGZP0jM6s0usLROqJa0JiBoB_/pub?output=csv")|>
  group_by(Team) |>
  summarize(
    avg_winper = mean(win, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  arrange(desc(avg_winper))


sb <- "https://www.pro-football-reference.com/super-bowl/" 

sbchamp <- sb |>
  read_html() |>
   html_node(xpath = '//*[@id="super_bowls"]') |>
html_table() 
  
appearances <- sbchamp |>
     pivot_longer(cols = c(Winner, Loser), values_to = "team") |>
  count(team, name = "appearances")

winsonly <- sbchamp |>
  select(Winner) |>
   count(Winner, name = "wins") |>
  arrange(desc(wins))

loseronly <- sbchamp |>
  select(Loser) |>
   count(Loser, name = "loser") |>
  arrange(desc(loser))

GB <- winsonly |>
  filter(Winner == "Green Bay Packers")


offdef <- read_csv("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vQ2q17BqWtzbtCjTtHVKDXkwN8wkD2iXww5pSWUZVBfgJkB5Oomelb5DeFyq_SzSP6TyTnG9hV41h_S/pub?gid=0&single=true&output=csv") |>
  group_by(Team) |>
  summarize(
    avg_ORtg = mean(ORtg, na.rm = TRUE), avg_DRtg = mean(DRtg, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) |>
  arrange(desc(avg_ORtg))

Two key metrics, offensive and defensive rating, provide insight into how efficiently teams score points and how well they prevent opponents from scoring. This chart visualizes the average offensive and defensive percentage over recent seasons. The blue points represent offensive ratings, while the red points represent defensive ratings. Each line connects a team’s offensive and defensive ratings, allowing a quick visual comparison of strengths and weaknesses.

Code 
ggplot() +
  geom_dumbbell(
    data = offdef,
    aes(
      y = reorder(Team, avg_DRtg),
      x = avg_ORtg,
      xend = avg_DRtg
    ), size = 2,
    colour = "lightgrey",
    colour_x = "blue",
    colour_xend = "red"
  ) +
theme_minimal() +
   theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x="Average Offensive Percentage", 
    y="Average Defensive Percentage", 
    title="Border Battle in the NBA", 
    subtitle="The average offensive and defensive percentages in these teams over the last eight seasons. Blue = Offense, Red = Defense.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Lily Hemmmersbach"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
     plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=9), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

This chart visualizes total Super Bowl wins across NFL franchises, and the contrast between these two NFC North rivals is striking. The Packers’ bar stands filled in dark green, symbolizing the legacy they’ve built over decades. Meanwhile, the Vikings are absent from this highlighted list of champions. Four appearances, four losses, and decades without a return have left Minnesota watching from the outside as their biggest rival continues to build on a winning tradition.

Code 
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=winsonly, aes(x=reorder(Winner, wins), weight=wins), fill="lightgrey") +
geom_bar(data=GB, aes(x=reorder(Winner, wins), weight=wins), fill="darkgreen")+
  coord_flip() +
theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x="Super Bowl Wins", 
    y="Team", 
    title="Super Bowl Wins, but Where are the Vikings?", 
    subtitle="Super Bowls wins in the NFL for all time. Highlighted in green is the Green Bay Packers, up one in the border battle.", 
    caption="Source: Pro Football Reference| By Lily Hemmmersbach"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
     plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=9), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

Green Bay Packers: 4. Minnesota: Still trying.

Don’t get me wrong, the Vikings have made it to the Super bowl four times, but have choked every single time. Close calls? A few. Championships? None.

Even after this first two graphs show the real winner of the battle with the lack of Minnesota even pulling off one Super Bowl win, you’re still not convinced? With this last graph, it is the win percentage in the MLB. Take a look at who comes out on top more.

Code 
mlb|> 
  arrange(desc(avg_winper)) |>
  gt() |>
  cols_label(
    Team = "Team Name",
    avg_winper = "Average Win Percent", 
    ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "WI in Top Five, Again Where is MN?",
    subtitle = "The average win percent in the MLB over the last five years. Wisconsin over Minnesota by a lot."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Lily Hemmersbach  |  **Source:** Team Rankings MLB")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12))) |>
   opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "navy"),
      cell_text(color = "white")
    ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Team == "Milwaukee"
    )
  ) |>
   tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "red"),
      cell_text(color = "white")
    ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Team == "Minnesota"
    )
  )
WI in Top Five, Again Where is MN?
The average win percent in the MLB over the last five years. Wisconsin over Minnesota by a lot.
Team Name Average Win Percent
LA Dodgers 0.6258
Houston 0.5770
Milwaukee 0.5650
NY Yankees 0.5642
Atlanta 0.5638
Philadelphia 0.5552
Seattle 0.5454
Tampa Bay 0.5410
Toronto 0.5402
San Diego 0.5332
SF Giants 0.5270
Cleveland 0.5262
NY Mets 0.5234
Boston 0.5154
St. Louis 0.5102
Chi Cubs 0.4968
Baltimore 0.4926
Detroit 0.4864
Minnesota 0.4814
Cincinnati 0.4764
Texas 0.4694
Arizona 0.4692
Kansas City 0.4480
Miami 0.4446
LA Angels 0.4420
Pittsburgh 0.4272
Sacramento 0.4210
Chi Sox 0.4132
Washington 0.4048
Colorado 0.3772
By: Lily Hemmersbach | Source: Team Rankings MLB

Across all the graphs, one thing is clear, Wisconsin is the real winner of this border battle and will more then likely remain on top when it comes to sports, as well as beer and cheese. Momentum matters in rivalries, and Wisconsin has it. Right now the border battle isn’t just a rivalry, it’s a reminder on how Wisconsin is setting the standards between the two states.
